{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":2991182,"name":"Chris Mounts","username":"Chris_Mounts","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/chris_mounts/{size}/6848_2.png","created_at":"2022-01-14T00:37:53.947Z","cooked":"

Within a few months of getting our Velox CNC, we began having issues with the z-axis slipping. The issue seems to be with the coupling hub that goes between the servo and z-axis lead screw. In particular, the lead screw slips within the coupling. I was wondering if anyone else has had this issue and if you were able to find a solution?

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":21,"updated_at":"2022-01-14T00:37:53.947Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":204,"reads":240,"readers_count":239,"score":1068.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":400134,"topic_slug":"velox-cnc-z-axis-slip","display_username":"Chris Mounts","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":20736,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/velox-cnc-z-axis-slip/400134/1","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true,"can_vote":false},{"id":2991240,"name":"sanddrag","username":"sanddrag","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/s/c68b51/{size}.png","created_at":"2022-01-14T02:11:54.609Z","cooked":"

Just a wild guess here, but have you tried tightening the coupling?

So much so that I broke it tonight .

Bummer. What exactly broke? Pics?

","post_number":4,"post_type":1,"posts_count":21,"updated_at":"2022-01-14T03:39:57.393Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":3,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":4,"reads":205,"readers_count":204,"score":66.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":400134,"topic_slug":"velox-cnc-z-axis-slip","display_username":"sanddrag","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":20736,"username":"Chris_Mounts","name":"Chris Mounts","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/chris_mounts/{size}/6848_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":1082,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/velox-cnc-z-axis-slip/400134/4","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":2991506,"name":"Chris Mounts","username":"Chris_Mounts","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/chris_mounts/{size}/6848_2.png","created_at":"2022-01-14T15:25:38.093Z","cooked":"

The clamping collar snapped. The picture shows its pre-snapped state. After some thought on the issue, I think the problem is that the shaft coming out of the lead screw is slightly undersized. It appears that what Velox did was machine down the end of the lead screw to a 1/4" shaft but they undersized it. I’m not sure what will fix this short of making a new lead screw. These clamping collars are not made to be over-tightened.

PXL_20220113_215415381.MP695×927 123 KB

A new coupler shouldn’t be too hard to find at places like McMaster, Misumi, or places dedicated to selling CNC router parts.

","post_number":6,"post_type":1,"posts_count":21,"updated_at":"2022-01-14T15:35:13.885Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":161,"readers_count":160,"score":32.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":400134,"topic_slug":"velox-cnc-z-axis-slip","display_username":"sanddrag","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":1082,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/velox-cnc-z-axis-slip/400134/6","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":2991659,"name":"Jason Kyle","username":"jpk","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/j/71e660/{size}.png","created_at":"2022-01-14T18:29:00.345Z","cooked":"

A small amount of retaining compound on the shaft works wonders for slipping couplers. Not ideal since it becomes a fight to remove it later but when you’re dealing with undersized shafts and, in the case of your pictured coupler, non-precision couplers the options are limited. Unfortunate that it’s busted…

Thanks for the tip on retaining compound! I didn’t know this existed. New parts will be here Monday.

","post_number":8,"post_type":1,"posts_count":21,"updated_at":"2022-01-14T19:30:48.462Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":7,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":2,"reads":137,"readers_count":136,"score":42.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":400134,"topic_slug":"velox-cnc-z-axis-slip","display_username":"Chris Mounts","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":37701,"username":"jpk","name":"Jason Kyle","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/j/71e660/{size}.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":20736,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/velox-cnc-z-axis-slip/400134/8","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":2991702,"name":"Jason Kyle","username":"jpk","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/j/71e660/{size}.png","created_at":"2022-01-14T19:40:11.387Z","cooked":"

Keep it off the plastic bit though! And clean/degrease everything first before applying the retaining compound.

","post_number":9,"post_type":1,"posts_count":21,"updated_at":"2022-01-14T19:42:35.948Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":8,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":2,"reads":125,"readers_count":124,"score":50.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":400134,"topic_slug":"velox-cnc-z-axis-slip","display_username":"Jason Kyle","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":20736,"username":"Chris_Mounts","name":"Chris Mounts","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/chris_mounts/{size}/6848_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":2}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":37701,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/velox-cnc-z-axis-slip/400134/9","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"+1","type":"emoji","count":1},{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":2,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":2991770,"name":"sanddrag","username":"sanddrag","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/s/c68b51/{size}.png","created_at":"2022-01-14T20:50:06.236Z","cooked":"

If you want it to never come out, Loctite 680 on the shaft. And I do mean never. It takes a torch to remove. But, regular blue medium strength loctite on the screw is a good idea.

","post_number":10,"post_type":1,"posts_count":21,"updated_at":"2022-01-14T20:50:06.236Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":115,"readers_count":114,"score":28.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":400134,"topic_slug":"velox-cnc-z-axis-slip","display_username":"sanddrag","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":1082,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/velox-cnc-z-axis-slip/400134/10","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":2991797,"name":"josesantos","username":"josesantos","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/josesantos/{size}/5743_2.png","created_at":"2022-01-14T21:46:41.070Z","cooked":"
Chris_Mounts:

I think the problem is that the shaft coming out of the lead screw is slightly undersized.

If you’re particularly ambitious and have the tools for it, you could modify a compatible 6 [mm] coupler half to have the right fit for your undersized 1/4" nominal shaft end.

","post_number":11,"post_type":1,"posts_count":21,"updated_at":"2022-01-14T21:46:41.070Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":5,"quote_count":1,"incoming_link_count":2,"reads":113,"readers_count":112,"score":62.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":400134,"topic_slug":"velox-cnc-z-axis-slip","display_username":"josesantos","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":2}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":17071,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/velox-cnc-z-axis-slip/400134/11","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":2}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":2,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3087009,"name":"Chris Mounts","username":"Chris_Mounts","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/chris_mounts/{size}/6848_2.png","created_at":"2022-10-06T00:11:31.567Z","cooked":"

We are still having issues with our Z axis on the Velox. I’m wondering if any other teams are having this issue. We’ve been able to narrow down exactly what is happening.

When a command is issued to raise the Z axis the motor attempts to move but it does not. Mach3 thinks it’s moving up and adjust the Z value. The motor makes a slight buzzing noise. We have confirmed that the motor is not moving. It is easy to move the lead screw by hand and we’ve disassembled the entire Z axis and there appears to be nothing wrong with it.
We started by replacing the stepper motor. When that didn’t work, we replaced the stepper control module. That also did not work.

I’m out of ideas on what to try next. I’m starting to think that the Z axis stepper is undersized for the size of the spindle. We bought the upgraded Delta spindle from Velox. Does anyone else have this setup and it’s working?

","post_number":12,"post_type":1,"posts_count":21,"updated_at":"2022-10-06T00:11:31.567Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":6,"reads":98,"readers_count":97,"score":54.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":400134,"topic_slug":"velox-cnc-z-axis-slip","display_username":"Chris Mounts","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":20736,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/velox-cnc-z-axis-slip/400134/12","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3087012,"name":"s-neff","username":"s-neff","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/s-neff/{size}/9062_2.png","created_at":"2022-10-06T00:27:13.084Z","cooked":"

We observed the same (stock Z axis is undersize) and replaced the long nema23* with the same nema34* motor used on the y and x years ago while velox was still in business. Worked like a charm ever since.

Since we purchased the upgrade direct from velox, I don’t have part numbers or suggestions on adapters and connectors to source your own solution.

@RoboChair swore theirs was fine stock.

I also generally have us cutting more aggressively than the 1678 feeds and speeds database.

(*I’m only 80% sure those were the frame sizes, and make sure the current/torque matches in addition to the frame size)

","post_number":13,"post_type":1,"posts_count":21,"updated_at":"2022-10-06T04:41:44.031Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":12,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":2,"reads":90,"readers_count":89,"score":33.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":400134,"topic_slug":"velox-cnc-z-axis-slip","display_username":"s-neff","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":3,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":20736,"username":"Chris_Mounts","name":"Chris Mounts","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/chris_mounts/{size}/6848_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":28019,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/velox-cnc-z-axis-slip/400134/13","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3087038,"name":"Garrison","username":"Garrison","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/garrison/{size}/7824_2.png","created_at":"2022-10-06T04:37:29.517Z","cooked":"

We’ve been seeing this issue intermittently for the last 2 years. We’re currently trying out a significantly decreased maximum acceleration on the Z-axis. This was set in Mach3.

We literally just set this yesterday so not sure if it will help. We were only seeing this every 20-30 runs and most often right at the start of the run.

I’m pretty sure that the stepper being undersized is the issue. I always thought it was odd that the Z axis stepper was so small. A few questions for you though.

  • Can you take a few photos of the stepper connection? I assume it’s just a new adapter piece and the larger motor.
  • Did you have to make any other changes to support the larger stepper motor or was it a purely mechanical upgrade?

We had an issue with the Z-axis of our Velox in 842’s shop. It appeared to be losing steps every now and then and we didn’t know why. Eventually it was traced back to where the wires for the motor plug into the driver/control box. As I recall one wire was not stripped far enough and was making an intermittent connection. We dressed the wire end to fix the issue.

Might not be your problem, but worth checking.

After replacing the stepper controller (didn’t fix our issue) I would strongly suggest anyone with a Velox take a look at the wire connections to the controller. Ours were not great either. Some not stripped enough, some stripped far too much. Several loose strands out of the screw connectors dangerously close other connectors.

We had all kinds of problems with our Z axis. At one point, we had a bunch of CPU coolers attached to it to try and stop it overheating. We eventually moved to ClearPath integrated servos and hardly use much of the Velox electronics anymore. Only stall the clearpaths when we crash.
